info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 11 at 2:43PM MDT until April 12 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. For lower elevations storm total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. For higher elevations, 4 to 9 inches with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting in excess of 40 mph, especially during frontal passage in the afternoon. * WHERE...Sawtooth, Stanley, Hailey, Bellevue, Picabo, Lost River Range, Copper Basin, Tom Cat Summit, Craters of the Moon, and Arco. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Near white out conditions with frontal passage in afternoon. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
